required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PMCF Study to Examine the Debridement Pad Cutimed DebriClean
clinical_study.official_title: Post Market Clinical Follow up Study to Examine Clinical Performance of the Debridement Pad Cutimed DebriClean

brief_summary.textblock: Documentation of the performance and safety of the debridement pad Cutimed DebriClean in daily clinical practice

detailed_description.textblock:
60 subjects with superficial wounds in need of debridement will undergo mechanical debridement with the study product.
Per subject, one application of the study product will be documented including photo documentation of the wound and evaluation of the wound bed condition and wound size before and after the debridement.

primary_outcome.measure: Change of wound bed condition from baseline to assessment immediately after the mechanical debridement (within one study visit)
primary_outcome.time_frame: assessed immediately before and immediately after the mechanical debridement (within one study visit)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage of wound coverage with debris/necrosis/slough Wound edge cleaned smooth Surrounding skin cleaned e.g. from skin flakes

secondary_outcome.measure: Wound size after and before wound debridement
secondary_outcome.time_frame: assessed immediately before and immediately after the mechanical debridement (within one study visit)
secondary_outcome.description: Wound length and wound width are measured using a wound ruler. Wound size is calculated using the formula A = length x width x π/4.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time needed for the debridement procedure
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Time is measured during the debridement procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Time from start to completion of the debridement procedure in minutes

secondary_outcome.time_frame: assessed immediately after the mechanical debridement

secondary_outcome.measure: Structural integrity of the test product
secondary_outcome.time_frame: assessed immediately after the mechanical debridement
secondary_outcome.description: assessed by the investigator (e.g. change in shape, loosening of fibers, …)

secondary_outcome.time_frame: assessed immediately after the debridement procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Patient reported pain assessed using a visual analogue scale. If applicable, duration of pain is documented.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: assessed immediately after the debridement procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Discomfort, pressure, burning sensation, bleeding, and irritation of the periwound skin during or after the mechanical debridement, other adverse device effects swelling; redness

arm_group.description: Subjects will undergo one mechanical debridement procedure with Cutimed DebriClean

intervention.description: The mechanical debridement is performed using the debridement pad Cutimed DebriClean. After the pad is moistened with wound-cleansing solution, the wound is cleaned using circular movements while applying gentle pressure.

study_pop.textblock: Subjects with superficial wounds in need of debridement, for example diabetic ulcers, venous and arterial ulcers, pressure sores, postoperative wounds and wounds healing by secondary intention, superficial burns, the absorption of exudate, slough and dry skin flakes.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female subjects aged 18 years or older with full legal competence
- Signed informed consent
- Subjects with wounds in need of debridement, especially diabetic ulcers, venous and arterial ulcers, pressure sores, postoperative wounds and wounds healing by secondary intention, superficial burns
- Superficial wound
- Minimum 30 % of the wound is covered by debris, necrosis or slough
- Wound size > 4 cm²
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subjects not willing to participate or to attend the scheduled study visit
- Known sensitivity or allergy to the product components
- Severe pain or hyperaesthesia in the wound area
- Patients who are pregnant or lactating
- Drug abuse or alcohol abuse
- Patients who participate in any other clinical study investigating drugs or medical devices

facility.name: Universitäres Herz- und Gefäßzentrum, Universitätsklinikum Hamburg-Eppendorf

patient_data.ipd_description: No IPD will be shared. Data are needed for post market clinical follow up.
